messages.message:
*100 files per batch limit*

Hey folks does anyone know why we have a limit of 100 files per batch? As AI Hub ramps to be able to handle enterprise loads, this limit is one that we are getting more questions about (even commercial customers I believe as asking about this). cc: @Venkatesh
It is not a file system limit. cc @andy on whether we can raise this limit since Wilson worked on batches.
I would argue this should be 10,000 at least

i believe 50 was the original arbitrary limit at launch. @tony.shi and @Anil helped raise this to 100 earlier this year for some POV. but i don't think we ever dedicated any resources to doing load testing to actually raise it to the appropriate ceiling, which i also agree should be on the order of thousands

CC: @Kerry since we talked about this at the eng leaders offsite this week
i would be comfortable with just increasing the limit a lot rn and then just seeing where we go from there
we should def increase -- but also should test with 1,000 and increments of thousands up to at least 10,000

The API (the public API) doesnâ€™t have a batch size limit. The UI is using an old endpoint that does that have a limit.
We just run a big test at CASS which had multiple 1000 file runs - they ran fine.

Will work with @tony.shi to see if we can have the UI also use the public API and get rid of this arg altogether.
